H0.text: Black holes are so dense in astronomy that not even light can escape their gravity.

H1.text: Black rods are objects in astronomy that are so dense that not even light can escape their gravity.

H2.text: Dwarf stars are objects in astronomy that are so dense that not even light can escape their gravity.

H3.text: Red holes are so dense in astronomy that not even light can escape their gravity.

A4.text: The idea of a body so massive that even light could not escape was briefly proposed by English astronomical pioneer and clergyman John Michell and independently by French scientist Pierre-Simon Laplace.

A5.text: The average density of a 108 Mâ˜‰ black hole is comparable to that of water.
